title: Quick & Easy Cards: Floral & Gold Foil Set - Card Tutorial / Process Video

json.text: welcome back crafty friends  it's Alicia of the call me crafty al YouTube channel I
know it's been a while since I've been here and the end of the school year was
crazy and then I had my mom was in town for a couple things and the last week
and a half I've been trying to clean out my craft area so I could come back and
start being creative and it is finally good enough to use I can get around I do
have actually a work surface now that I can use and I had went out today to
Michael's to look at the new hot buy pads because there are 70% off and I
wanted to see if I liked any of them well enough to get them I decided like I
kinda liked probably two of them but you know what I have more paper than I am
ever going to be able to use so I did not buy them but when I was in just a
regular paper aisle these three pieces of paper caught my eye and these are
some of the specialty papers I believe they're a dollar ninety-nine per sheet
originally they were a little bit off today I'm gonna say like maybe 20% which
I didn't know I was actually willing to pay full price for these I had one 50%
off coupon but I love them so much and this one here with the little 3 by 4
cards caught my eye first I liked all of the sayings and I liked the gold foiling
and I thought that could probably make some nice simple cards because the
sentiments already there some of them have decoration and these other two
papers they were beside this one so I thought that those would all go nicely
together so I picked those up and what I thought I would do today while you're
here with me is make some quick and easy cards with these all I'm gonna be using
that I know of right now will be these three pieces of patterned paper as well
as some cardstock for the bases and formatting but I plan on getting
twelve cards from these three pieces of paper plus some card blanks so let's see
if I can do that the first thing I'm going to do is cut this sheet into the
three by four cards and then I'm going to cut each of the pattern papers into
four by five and a quarter inch pieces of paper and then I will put them
together and kind of see how each card works best with a pattern behind it so
let's get started
now as I get ready to cut the cards down smaller I've actually not been using the
grid for measurements I've been using the lines between the cards so I might
have to do some adjusting later to get them to three by four or my mats might
be slightly different
the reason that I'm cutting the pattern papers to four by five and a quarter is
because my card base itself will be folded to four and a quarter by five and
a half so this way I have just a little border all the way around the pattern
paper on the card front and cutting it to four inches wide also allows me to be
able to get six pieces from each of the pattern papers for now all of my cutting
is done what I'm gonna do is in my stash I'm gonna try to find a pink that nicely
matches the sentiment and like the background in this one and I'll matte
some of those in pink and then my plan for the other ones is either to use my
cardstock that is just a little off-white it's not an ivory and it's not
white because that's what these cards are in the background or I might use a
gray color and because of the size of these I can probably find some scraps to
use so this is going to be a great way to use up some scraps you might have
now this pink is not perfect for this card but it's gonna be close enough
because I will not have it matting the pink I will have it matting a different
colored card
okay now that I have my matting cardstocks picked out what I'm going to
do is go through and put each of the three by four cards with a background
paper and then I will decide which mat I will be using which color cardstock that
I will be using now right now my plan is if it is only a sentiment I think I'm
going to try to use the bigger floral background alright but if the sentiment
has some of those flowers already then I'm gonna use this just single color
with the gold background again that's my plan I don't know how it's gonna end up
with how many cards I have so let's go ahead and get this going
okay right here I already have an exception this is only a sentiment but
because the card background is the same as the gray here I am gonna put this on
one of these over here I might end up changing it we'll see later on
you
now I am down to three cards and none of them have like the floral embellishment
on it they're all just sentiments and I only have these three pieces left so I'm
going to kind of see how each of these looks okay so I have all of these with
their coordinating color for the back what I'm gonna do now is go through and
decide what color mat I want it to be on and to separate those out so again for
my matte colors I have that kind of just very off-white kind of the eggshell it's
called natural ice and I'm gonna have it's a grey and I'm gonna have a pink so
I'm gonna stack those up there
alright those are all separated now so I'm going to go ahead and map the little
cards or the sentiment cards now some of them like you'll see here on this one
they did have it just a slight border from when I cut them down to three by
four so some of them I will need to trim that off that excess but that's it so
I'm gonna go ahead and just map these up
here is one of the cards and it has been adhered to the mat color and trimmed out
with the even border so there's kind of what that card will look like and I'll
go ahead and just continue that with the rest of these
all right the next thing I'm gonna do I grabbed six pieces of the natural ice
card stock I'm just gonna cut those in half lengthways and then I will fold
them to the card bases so I'll do that off-camera and I'll be back in just a
little bit all of my card bases are ready to go ahead and start putting
together I think I'm going to go ahead and on the top piece I'm gonna use some
of my foam rectangles that I bought at the Dollar Tree to just pop this up off
the card and that will just give us some dimension I know I've shared these
before but this is just a roll of foam they're rectangles and it was only a
dollar and I've already used some of these they hold really well and they're
easy to use and they're cheap so if you have a dollar tree near you and like to
use foam squares I would recommend going to get some of this I'm going to start
by adhering the background patterned paper to the card base
and then I'm gonna use some of the foam squares just on the back of this
sentiment piece
and I'm just centering that in there just as best as I can by eyeballing it
and one of the cards is complete I think my plan is to go and just put them all
together and then see if some of the ones that only have the sentiments that
there's no artwork on it see if I need to add something like maybe some sequins
or maybe I'll fussy cut some flowers from the leftover pattern paper from
this one you know if I can make something work
now I have the basic cards done and I could keep these how they were and they
would be just fine but some of the cards that are just sentiments they still have
quite a bit of white space so what I'm going to do is use some of the scraps
from cutting down the pattern paper so I have like these scraps I'm going to see
if I can use these in some way to decorate just some of that white space
so I'm gonna go ahead and select the ones that I'm going to add stuff to
okay I'm gonna see what I can add to these four cards here but the ones that
have the multicolored floral background I'm gonna see if I can use the other
background in some way just to bring out more of that pink and more of the gold
foil the first way that I'm gonna add some more detail to these cards is going
to be using one of my new favorite tools it is a Stampin Up tag punch I will find
the real name and link it for you below but what this does is it puts that
fishtail knotch in pieces of paper that either one one and a half or two inches
wide so what I've done is cut a piece of the pink floral paper down to one inch
and I am going to punch both sides of that into a fishtail
and if you've watched any Christy Marcotte videos she is a youtuber who
frequently makes lots of cards from one 6x6 paper pad she uses a lot of like
banners like this on the edges of some of her cards and I just really like that
so that's all I'm gonna do is I'm gonna cut a little one and try it up here
and see how that adds just a little something it brings in that other
pattern paper and takes away some of that white space
I think I might try something different on this one for this next one because
this isn't the right size what I'm going to do is I'm going to cut a piece same
idea though still that same fishtail banner I'm going to cut a piece of this
with my die cut machine and I like that size much better
for the last two cards again I'm going to see if I can incorporate this pattern
paper in some way I think for this one I'm going to do the same thing where I
cut it down to one inch wide and then punch it
and last but not least I have this fourth one
and I think I'm just gonna leave it alone I don't really like any way that I
can place these pieces so I'm gonna leave it as is and so now I have 12
cards that are ready to go I may give them away as a set I'm not sure yet but
let's go ahead and take one last look at these
thank you so much for joining me today as I made this little card set if you
enjoyed the video I hope you'll give it a thumbs up if you're new to my channel
and you think you might like to see more of what I create I hope you'll hit the
subscribe button below and as always if you're a regular viewer a subscriber
thank you for stopping back by I hope you're all having a crafty day
